did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: James Deitrick Papers,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] James Deitrick Papers, M0140, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This material spans the period from 1900 - 1918 with the bulk from 1914 through 1917. There are also a number of undated items. The collection consists of letters, a Protocol, bills, extracts from a diary, copies of contracts, powers of attorney and other legal papers, misc. financial papers and notes, various lists, clips and printed material, brochures, telegrams and cables, form letters, postcards, memos, notes and drafts, sketches, autographs, calling cards and maps.

The subject matter pertains almost exclusively to business in Russia, China, Nicaragua, Mexico and the United States. This includes construction of railroads, development of mining and agricultural lands and resources, sale of farm equipment, and war material. A few items touch on political affairs, particularly the correspondence with Sun Yat-sen, H. C. Stuart, Herbert Hoover and the Nathan Hale volunteers. See also M 92 and the partial index following the container list.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

eventgrp.event: --born in [UNK]. Sterling, Kentucky; son of Philip K. and Aletha Elizabeth (Martin) D.
--educated at the State University of Kentucky
--Southern Pacific Co. railway superintendent in California
--Santa Fe, location engineer in construction dept.
--confidential agent for Alan Manvel, Pres. of Santa Fe

chronitem.event: --agent for Brice and Morgan (or Brice Syndicate?)
--president Central Railway and Navigation Co., a Central American concern with office in Paris
--legal agent for C. L. Best Gas Traction Co. and Lewis Motor Truck Co.

eventgrp.event: --sales representative for Wellman, Peck and Co., wholesale grocers
--agent for Colt's Patent Fire Arms Manufacturing Co. in Russia, China and Japan
--agent for The Russell and Company James Rees and Sons Company Fuel Savers Gas Stoves Mfg. Co.

chronitem.event: --representative of Peters, White and Co. for importing potash.
--promotional work in Mexico and the United States

bioghist.p: Deitrick was a capitalist, an engineer, location, construction and contractor of railways in America, China and Siberia. He was also president of the Chinese Construction Co. His death date is unknown although he is known to have been dead by fall, 1932.

did.unittitle: 1. 1900,Photo of James Deitrick.
2. 1902, Apr. 25.C. F. Dean to J. W. Harriman. Introduction to Deitrick, funds for China affairs.
3. 1908, July 9.Wm. [Barbour] to J. Milne Barbour. Introduction to J.D., Belfast [Ireland] Rope Works.
4. 1911, July 20.W. E. Chilton to Elliott Northcott.
5. 1912, Mar. 2.J. H. Goeke to J.D. Enclosing letter of introduction (now missing) to Myron T. Herrick, U. S. ambassador to France; Nicaragua affairs.

7. 1912, Oct. 21.Typed copy of Protocol between Russia and Mongolia with ms. notations.
8. 1912, Dec. 25.London Wall Estate Ltd. to J.D. Bill for office rent.

56. Oct. 23.[J.D.] to Vladimir Generosoff. Mexican sisal.
57. Oct. 23.Ernest Telkes to Magda Telkes von Kelenfold. Prison camp.
58. Oct. 24.[J.D.] to Mr. Denisoff. Mexican sisal.
59. Oct. 27.Ernest Telkes to J.D.
60. Oct. 28.Dunham, Carrigan & Hayden Co. to Chinese-American Plantation Co.
61. Oct. 30.[J.D.] to Lin Sun. Airplanes
62. Oct. 30.Sloane Gordon to J.D.
63. Nov. 7.[J.D.] to Sloane Gordon. Mexico shipping and mining.
64. Nov. 13.George T. Webb to J.D.
65. Nov. 15.[J.D.] to Wu T'ing-fang. Railroad, Canton to Yunnan-fu.
66-67. Nov. 16.Sloane Gordon to J.D.
68. Nov. 22.Sloane Gordon to J.D. China, Lower California, manganese.
69. 1916, Nov. 23.Christofferson Aircraft Mfg. Co. to Sam Mustain.
70. Dec. 5.Sloane Gordon to J.D.
71. Dec. [11 or 16?][J.D.] to Sloane Gordon. Mexico, politics, manganese, clays, Arizona mining, General episode.
72. Dec. 21.Wu T'ing-fang (by sec.) to J.D. & cvr.
73. Dec. 29.[Alaska Packers Assn.] to Estaban Cantu with descriptions of 2 steamers.
74. 1916.Sailing schedule. Norwegian America Line.
75. 1916.The Russell & Co.
1. Jan. 17.[J.D.] to Esteban Cantu. Mexico, steamships, airplanes, railroad.
2. Feb. 11.Sam J. Mustain to Nom Lui (Chinese Nationalist League of America). Pilot, appeal for pay & expenses.
3. Feb. 18.[S. J. Lesh] to J.D. Electrical detection of ore bodies.
4. Feb. 22.[J.D.] to Tong Sui Nune. Mustain.
5. Mar. 5.F. H. G[ould] to William Kettner.
6. Mar. 29.Sloane Gordon to J.D. Lower Calif.
7-8. Apr. 9.[J.D.] to Sloane Gordon. Mexico, coquito nut kernels, mines, shipping, cotton & sugar cane lands, railroad plans, iron.
9. Apr. 12.Ernest Telkes to J.D.
10. May 10.[J.D.] to John A. McCarthy & Edward Mosehauer. Failure in Russia & China, Mexico, mining.
11. May 14.Nathan Hale Volunteers (Frederic Sumner Hughes) to [J.D.] re: I.D. cards & emblems. With blank Suspect Report, 2 ptd. announcements.
12. May 16.R. M. Ritter to J.D. Dr. Hugo Schweitzer.
13. May 18.Carlos [Ystas y C.] to J.D. Rifle, Cantu, Col. Macias, Pres. Carranzo.
14. 1917, May 24.Nathan Hale Vols. (F. S. Hughes) to J.D. with 2 membership application blanks.
15. May 28.[J.D.] to Esteban Cantu. Rifle, Col. Macias, Mexicali-San Felipe RR.
16. May.3 blank authorizations to Crocker National Bank.
17. [1917, May?]George O. Squire to J.D.
18. June 6.[J.D.] to Y. Nagashima of Mitsui & Co. Proposed cotton plantation.
19. June 25.Barton W. Evermann to Sec. San Francisco Chamber of Commerce. Whale meat as food.
20. June 26.H. Lawton to J.D. Mexican agricultura land.
21. Jul. 14.[J.D.] to Sloane Gordon. Mexico, manganese.
22. Jul. 18.Sloane Gordon to J.D. Copper property Arizona, Mexico.
23. Jul. 19.J. [E.] Kiler to J.D.
24. Aug. 2.Eduardo C. Garcia to R. D. Micotti. Mexico, fertilizer plant.
25. Aug. 3.Ralph [E.] Young to J.D. Mexico, bandit Espinoza.
26. Aug. 16.H. Lawton to J.D. Southern Pacific RR, Mexico, draft.

27. Aug. 21.[J.D.] to Intelligence Officer, Western Division, U. S. Army. Draft dodgers & deserters in Mexico, anti-American signs, German business houses and influence, train robbery, Francisco Espinosa & Ernest Radke.
28. Aug. 25.C. D. Smead to J.D. Photo of McPherson.
29. Aug. 29.L. J. Williams of Philippine Scouts to J.D. Visit to Angel Island.
30. Aug. 30.Homer Wilson to J.D.M. Manganese.
31. Aug. 31.Telfair Creighton to J.D.
32. [Sept. 1?]J.D. to Homer Wilson.
33. [Sept. 1?]Homer Wilson to J.D.
34. 1917, Sept. 2.W. A. Mundell to J.D. Requests interview re J.D.'s possible involvement in Hindu conspirators case.
35. Sept. 5.Delos C. Emmons to J.D. Henley.
36. Oct. 1.Second Liberty Loan of 1917 to [J.D.]
37-41. Oct. 4.Samuel J. Mustain to Chinese Nationalis League of America; statement of employment; amount due; - J.D.
42. Oct. 9.Robert S. Norman to J.D. Mustain.
43. Oct. 15.J.D. to [Samuel J. Mustain?]
44-45. Oct. 18.Samuel J. Mustain to F. H. Gould with Power of Attorney.
46. Oct. 20.F. H. Gould to Lin Sun et al.
47. Nov. 16.Presidential Proclamation - Alien Enemies.
48. Nov. 28.Presidential Proclamation - Exports.
49. Nov. 28.Presidential Proclamation - Imports.
50. Dec. 8.Certificate of J.D. deposition Oct. 23, 1917.
a. Post Wheeler cert. of Shinjiro Hashimoto deposition.
b. Oct. 23.Shinjiro Hashimoto deposition.
c. Oct. 23.J. W. Ballantine cert. of translation.
d-f. Oct. 20-22.certs of contracts.
51-52. Dec. 11.Ryozo Hashimoto to J.D. Steel plates for war ships.
53. [1917].Nathan Hale Vols. to [J.D.] and 2 suspect report forms. s. Rufus W. Putnam, U.S.A. Intelligence Officer.
54. [1918, May 19?]Unknown (Junzaburo) to J.D.
UNDATED MATERIAL AND FRAGMENTS
MISCELLANEOUS

scopecontent.p: Notes, sketches, autographs, bills, telegrams, printed material, callingcards.

did.unittitle: MAPS
1. Asia ca. 1915.Ptd. with pencil additions.
2. Russian Volunteer Fleet Sailing Routes ca. 1915.Ptd., pencil & ink notations. Vladivostok & Lena River.
3. Russian Empire ca. 1915.Printed in Russian
4. Russian Empire ca. 1910.Partial showing Turkestan area, Omsk south to Lake Balkhash (now Kazakh S.S.R.) in Russian.
5. Russian Empire 1910.Blowup of #4. East of Lake Balkhash along Ili River between Ili and Kuldja in China or Mongolia. Printed in Russian
6. Russian Empire 1910.Holograph tracing of #5 showing proposed canal routes, mining, grazing and swamp areas.

7. Russian Empire ca. 1915.Hand executed map showing the junctions of the Narym and Bukhtarma Rivers with the Irtysh River and the towns of Zyryanovsk and Aleksandrovskaja (now [UNK]) on the [Berezovka] River.
Photographs
1) 9 prints from the air show in Kobe, Japan.

scopecontent.p: See also nitrate negative file for 15 negatives, 9 of which have prints with them.

did.unittitle: 2) 7 8x10 prints of [UNK] [California?]
